# Kontext SDK

> Trust infrastructure for AI agents that move money.

Kontext is a TypeScript SDK (v0.7.0) that provides compliance audit trails, OFAC screening, trust scoring, on-chain anchoring, and agent-to-agent attestation for autonomous wallet transfers. Zero runtime dependencies. MIT license.

## Quick Start

```bash
npm install kontext-sdk
```

```typescript
import { Kontext } from 'kontext-sdk';
const ctx = Kontext.init({ projectId: 'my-project' });
const result = await ctx.verify({
  txHash: '0xabc...', chain: 'base', amount: '5000',
  token: 'USDC', from: '0xsender', to: '0xrecipient',
  agentId: 'payment-agent',
});
// result.compliant, result.trustScore, result.digestProof, result.anchorProof
```

## Key Pages

- [Documentation](https://getkontext.com/docs): Full SDK docs with code examples
- [Pricing](https://getkontext.com/pricing): Free (20K events/mo) and Pro ($2/1K above 20K)
- [Use Cases](https://getkontext.com/use-cases): USDC payments, x402, Stripe, treasury, on-chain anchoring, A2A attestation
- [Integrations](https://getkontext.com/integrations): Vercel AI SDK, LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen
- [FAQs](https://getkontext.com/faqs): Common questions about Kontext
- [Blog](https://getkontext.com/blog): Engineering articles on compliance and audit trails
- [GitHub](https://github.com/Legaci-Labs/kontext): Source code (MIT)
- [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/kontext-sdk): Package registry

## Core Capabilities

1. **verify()** — OFAC screening + transaction logging + trust scoring + digest proof in one call
2. **Digest chain** — Tamper-evident SHA-256 hash chain for every logged action (patented)
3. **On-chain anchoring** — Write terminal digest to a Base smart contract for immutable proof
4. **A2A attestation** — Exchange compliance digests between agent counterparties
5. **Trust scoring** — 0-100 score from 5 factors (history, amount, frequency, destination, behavior)
6. **Anomaly detection** — Rule-based detection (unusualAmount, frequencySpike + 4 Pro rules)
7. **Compliance certificates** — Exportable certificates with digest proof + trust score + reasoning
8. **Agent reasoning logs** — Log why agents made decisions, linked to digest chain
9. **Agent forensics** — Wallet-to-agent mapping, multi-wallet clustering (5 heuristics), identity confidence scoring (Pro)
10. **CLI** — 12 commands for compliance operations from the terminal (`@kontext-sdk/cli`)

## MCP Integration

Kontext exposes an MCP server for Claude Code, Cursor, and Windsurf:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "kontext": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "kontext-sdk", "mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

MCP tools: verify_transaction, check_sanctions, log_reasoning, get_trust_score, get_compliance_certificate, anchor_digest, exchange_attestation, verify_audit_trail.

## CLI (@kontext-sdk/cli)

```bash
npm install -g @kontext-sdk/cli
kontext verify --chain base --amount 5000 --token USDC --from 0xSender --to 0xRecipient
```

12 commands: check, verify, reason, cert, audit, anchor, attest, sync, session, checkpoint, status, mcp.

## Supported Chains

Base, Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Arc, Avalanche, Solana (free tier: Base only).

## Supported Tokens

USDC, USDT, DAI, EURC.

## Compliance Thresholds

- $3,000: Enhanced Due Diligence (Travel Rule)
- $10,000: Currency Transaction Report (CTR)
- $50,000: Large Transaction Alert

## Full Documentation

See [llms-full.txt](https://getkontext.com/llms-full.txt) for complete API reference and code examples.
